sanskrit_verse: अपसव्यमग्नौ कृत्वा सर्वमावृत्य विक्रमम् । आवृत्परिक्रमं अपसव्येन हस्तेन निर्वपेदुदकं भुवि ॥ ३.२१४॥
transliteration: apasavyam agnau kṛtvā sarvam āvṛtya vikramam | āvṛta-parikramaṃ apasavyena hastena nirvaped udakaṃ bhuvi || 3.214 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: Having placed the fire in the southern direction and covering all sides with sacred enclosures, one shall pour oblations using the left hand while circumambulating in reverse order.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority of directional alignment in ritual performance
Causation through precise bodily and spatial orientation
Capacity-based responsibility for maintaining cosmic order via prescribed action
Restoration logic rooted in sequential sacred enactment
Consciousness alignment through disciplined ritual conduct
executable_legal_axioms: IF ritual_fire_direction ≠ south THEN invalid_action = true
IF hand_used ≠ left AND motion ≠ counterclockwise THEN violation_detected = true
IF perimeter_not_enclosed BEFORE oblation THEN integrity_breach = true
IF action_sequence ≠ [enclose, position, circumambulate, offer] THEN restoration_required = true
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters involving ceremonial or constitutional dharmic duties, the Court must recognize that procedural precision determines ontological validity. Misalignment in execution renders acts legally null due to lack of causal completion, not moral failure.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that misaligned ritual action disrupts sequential manifestation (anupūrvaśaḥ). Responsibility arises from capacity-awareness, not fault. Correction restores alignment without punitive attribution.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Re-performance under supervision until correct sequence achieved
Guided reorientation to directional and procedural awareness
Integration into community practice to restore energetic coherence
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this Dharma stands executed. Ritual alignment is restored. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone adjudicates.
